meanings.sent1: The leaves were dindling in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She dindled the pencil between her fingers absentmindedly.
meanings.sent3: The cat dindled with the string, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The flames dindled in the fireplace, casting a warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The boat dindled on the waves, rocking gently.

meanings.definition: To waste time in a trifling way
meanings.sent1: Stop dindling and finish your homework.
meanings.sent2: He spent the afternoon dindling instead of working.
meanings.sent3: She was dindling around, rearranging her desk for the tenth time.
meanings.sent4: Time dindled away as they chatted aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: Don't dindle your time away on unimportant tasks.

meanings.definition: To play with something in a nervous or restless manner
meanings.sent1: She dindled with her necklace during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The child dindled with the buttons on his shirt, waiting for the doctor.
meanings.sent3: He dindled with the pen, clicking it repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers dindled with the edge of the paper, a sign of her anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The dog dindled with the toy, wagging its tail excitedly.
